MISDataPath.description: This address used to keep images and snapshots and other data, and used in pacs for importing data

PulseTimerPeriod.description: The system core pulse timer period in milliseconds. This value determines how often system status (tracking, navigation, ...) is refreshed/updated.

DontShowProcedureSelection.hrname: Do not show Procedure Selection UI on application startup
DontShowProcedureSelection.description: Do not show Procedure Selection UI on application startup

RenderingSampleRate.description: 0 and 1 indicate the lowest and highest acceptable rendering quality respectively

showSplashScreen.description: Specifies whether the application splash screen should be displayed at application startup while waiting for application resources to be loaded.

EnableVoiceCommand.description: Enable Capture, Accept and Reset voice commands for landmark registeration tab.

WorkflowButtonSet.description: Defines type of the surgery which will affect all aspects of application behaviour (appearance, image slice views, ...)

UsersRegistryFilePath.description: Absolute or relative path to the XML file containing users' description records (which specify each user by their ID and profile directory path).

Ent.description: Name of the file located within each user's profile directory and contain their preferences. The file must exist and be similar, in structure, to that of the default user, except that users' preference files might omit any of the preference items, in which case that of the default user will be used for the user in question.

Cranial.description: Name of the file located within each user's profile directory and contain their preferences. The file must exist and be similar, in structure, to that of the default user, except that users' preference files might omit any of the preference items, in which case that of the default user will be used for the user in question.

Spine.description: Name of the file located within each user's profile directory and contain their preferences. The file must exist and be similar, in structure, to that of the default user, except that users' preference files might omit any of the preference items, in which case that of the default user will be used for the user in question.

Biopsy.description: Name of the file located within each user's profile directory and contain their preferences. The file must exist and be similar, in structure, to that of the default user, except that users' preference files might omit any of the preference items, in which case that of the default user will be used for the user in question.

CMF.description: Name of the file located within each user's profile directory and contain their preferences. The file must exist and be similar, in structure, to that of the default user, except that users' preference files might omit any of the preference items, in which case that of the default user will be used for the user in question.

LegacySqlServer.description: Enable this option to use the legacy Microsoft SQL Server persistence for patient and solution data.

SqliteDatabaseFilePath.description: Complete or relative file path where the main application SQLite database is stored and retrieved from.

SqliteExportDbFilePath.description: Complete or relative file path to be used as a temporary database during exporting and importing of a solution from database.

SaveRawImageFilePath.description: Complete or relative folder path where the raw data for the images (with metadata within the database) are stored.

MriLevelWindowCenterCoeffs.description: The parameters are calculated by fitting the equation of (center = offset + MeanCoeff * Mean + StdCoeff * STD) on the center values which are manually set to some MRI images for a suitable contrast. The data is available in $/misSolution_2010/misSoloution/Documents/Research/MRI_level_window_params_fitting.

MeanCoeff.hrname: Coefficient for mean value of image intensity

StdCoeff.hrname: Coefficient for standard deviation of image intensity

MriLevelWindowWidthCoeffs.description: The parameters are calculated by fitting the equation of (width = offset + MeanCoeff * Mean + StdCoeff * STD) on the width values which are manually set to some MRI images for a suitable contrast. The data is available in $/misSolution_2010/misSoloution/Documents/Research/MRI_level_window_params_fitting.

MeanCoeff.hrname: Coefficient for mean value of image intensity

StdCoeff.hrname: Coefficient for standard deviation of image intensity

CtLevelWindowParams.description: Two constant parameters are assumed for center and width of the level window. The values are estimated based on the values which are manually set in order to displaying CT images with a suitable contrast.

MRILevelWindowParams.description: Two constant parameters are assumed for center and width of the level window. The values are estimated based on the values which are manually set in order to displaying MRI images with a suitable contrast.

VisibilityMarginInAnatomicalPlanesDirect.description: Specifies the needed distance between two slice (landmark slice and tool position slice ) for visbilty of landmarks,the reported distabce in application is direct distnace between 2 points
Specifies the needed distance between two slice (landmark slice and tool position slice ) for visbilty of landmarks,the reported distabce in application is direct distnace between 2 points

DisplayProjection.description: Biopsy plan projection on image plane

UserType.description: Type of the user performing calibration. For different user type, different calibration profiles are invoked. E.g., ordinary users are only allowed to perform validation on fixed tools whereas administrators can fully calibrate both detached and fixed tools.

DataBufferLength.description: Length of the data buffer used for calibration data gathering, that is, the number of consecutive instantaneous tool transform instances that should be analyzed for fixation (of orientation and/or position) and if found "roughly" fixed (basedon the fixation threshold values.

TipCalibrationStrategy.description: The strategy used for calibration of the tool tip position. Possible values are "Fixed Tip Position Mean" (the tool tip is held fixed at a previously known spatial position - on the calibration tool), and "Fixed Pivot Point Calculation" (the tip of the tool is held fixed at any position while the stem of the tool is rotated.

AutomaticCalibration.description: Determines whether automatic calibration is by default enabled.

WaitingTimeBeforeCalibrationStarts.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait after detecting a new tracking tool before the tool accuracy window is displayed (if the tool is still visible after that time).

PreCalibrationWaitTimeGrowthFactor.description: The factor by which to increase the WaitingTimeBeforeCalibrationStarts parameter of a tracking tool each time the user cancels the calibration popup screen.

WaitingTimeAfterCalibrationDone.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait after automatic calibration/validation process is completed before the tool accuracy window is automatically closed.

ToolCalibrationValidityPeriod.description: Time, in seconds, that a calibrated tool is considered valid and is not recalibrated even if the application is restarted and the tool is detected again. It acts based on the last calibration time tag of each tracking tool.

TrackerToolDataLog.description: Settings related to the logging of tracker tool data which periodically records spatial correlation between tracking tools.

OutputFilePath.description: Path to the output file where the log will be stored. If the file exists, it will be truncated.

Interval.description: Length of time, in seconds, between sequential log records. Very small intervals could negatively affect performance of the application.

LoggerList.description: List of names assigned to individual loggers each of which are in charge of logging correlation between a set of two tracker tools to a file.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether this logger should be enabled.

SourceToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the source tracker tool.

DestinationToolPartNumber.description: Part number of the destination tracker tool.

TypeOfTracker.description: Type of the tracker that will be used for navigation.

TrackerCommunicationFailureRateThreshold.description: Threshold for the rate of failed communication attempts within the last evaluation period. A failure rate above this threshold will cause reporting a disconnected state. The threshold is in the range [0..1].

MicronTrackerConnectivityEvaluationDurat.description: Amount of time, in seconds, during which tracker connectivity is observed and failure rate is compared with the threshold.

PolarisTrackerConnectivityEvaluationDura.description: Amount of time, in seconds, during which tracker connectivity is observed and failure rate is compared with the threshold.

TimeForCheckFixedOrMoving.hrname: Time between two frame for check fixed or moving

TimeFixingKernel.hrname: Maximum time for extending smoothing kernel when tool is fixed

ReferencePrefixList.description: Prioritized list of values to be used as reference prefix for Micron tracker such that if any of the tools whose part number contains the first item on the list will be taken as tracker reference. If none of the tools match the first item on the list, it moves on to the second item on the list and so on.

StartupNumberOfPointsForPointBasedRegist.description: Initial number of landmark points presented to the user to be used in registration.

DelayBeforeLandmarkCaptureOffCalibration.description: Initial value for time waiting, in seconds, before starting to capture landmarks during registration after the tool calibration is applied.

NearestLandmarkDistance.description: Allowed distance between 2 captured point in surface registration.

EnableTrackingInRegistrationTab.description: After capturing the last selected landmark the registration result is applied and tracking the tool is enabled in the registration tab.

VisibilityMarginInAnatomicalPlanesDirect.description: Specifies the needed distance between two slice (landmark slice and tool position slice ) for visbilty of landmarks,the reported distabce in application is direct distnace between 2 points

SphereRadiusSliderRange.description: Set range of threshold slider in data checking tab.

CameraFocalPointDistanceFromPlan.description: Distance, in world coordinates, of the stage camera focal point from the plan start point along the negative plan axis, that is, plan end point to plan start point.

CameraPositionDistanceFromPlan.description: Initial distance, in world coordinates, of the stage camera position from the plan start point along the negative plan axis, that is, plan end point to plan start point. The camera distance is subsequently modified by the automatic zoom controller.

OrientationGuideArrowVisualScale.description: Visual scale factor of the orientation navigation guide arrow. Use this to enlarge or shrink the arrow regardless of current stage zoom (which is controlled automatically).

OrientationGuideArrowViewPosition.description: The view coordinates of the orientation navigation guide arrow (arrow start point) on the stage

ToolLength.description: The length, in world measures, of the tracking tool used for navigation. This is used to place the orientation navigation guide mark near the tail end of the tool.

ThresholdAngle.description: The threshold angle, in degrees, for scaling the guide. Scale of the guide mark is calculated as the ratio of the angle between plan direction and tool orientation over the threshold.

MinimumGuideScale.description: The minimum scale of the guide mark. The guide mark shrinks linearly with the magnitude of the angle between plan and tool. This minimum keeps the guide mark from shrinking out of sight.

MaximumGuideScale.description: The maximum scale of the guide mark. The guide mark grows linearly with the magnitude of the angle between plan and tool. This maximum keeps the guide mark from growing out of convenience.

GuideArrowColour.description: Colour of the guide arrow using R/G/B colour scheme

CaptionColour.description: The colour of the caption using R/G/B colour scheme

CaptionPosition.description: The position, in viewport normalized coordinates, of the caption relative to the position of the guide arrow tail point.

CaptionSize.description: Sets the size of the caption rectangle in view port normalized measures.

ToriBasedOrientationNavigationGuide.description: The properties object for the tori based navigation guide.

ToriCollectionPropertiesForTool.description: The properties used by the torus collection displaying position and orientation of the plan.

NumberOfTori.description: Number of tori to be displayed.

CrossSectionRadius.description: Cross section radius of all the tori.

SmallestRingRadius.description: Inner radius of the smallest torus in the collection.

RingRadiusIncrementSize.description: Amount of increment applied to the radius of every next torus in the collection with respect to the one immediately before it.

XYPlaneDisplacement.description: Distance from the smallest torus to the XY plane (assuming the axis of the tori is parallel to the Z axis).

RingsSeparation.description: Distance between the planes containing each two adjacent tori within the collection.

ToriColour.description: Color of the tori using the R/G/B color scheme

ToriCollectionPropertiesForPlan.description: The properties used by the torus collection displaying position and orientation of the tracking tool.

NumberOfTori.description: Number of tori to be displayed.

CrossSectionRadius.description: Cross section radius of all the tori.

SmallestRingRadius.description: Inner radius of the smallest torus in the collection.

RingRadiusIncrementSize.description: Amount of increment applied to the radius of every next torus in the collection with respect to the one immediately before it.

XYPlaneDisplacement.description: Distance from the smallest torus to the XY plane (assuming the axis of the tori is parallel to the Z axis).

RingsSeparation.description: Distance between the planes containing each two adjacent tori within the collection.

ToriColour.description: Color of the tori using the R/G/B color scheme

ThresholdDistance.description: The threshold distance, in degrees, for scaling the guide. Distances greater than or equal to this will identically scale the guide, while smaller angles scale down the guide to the tool tip to start point distance and the threshold angle.

MinimumGuideScale.description: The minimum scale of the guide mark. The guide mark shrinks linearly with the decreasing distance between tool tip and the plan start point. This minimum keeps the guide mark from shrinking out of sight.

MaximumGuideScale.description: The maximum scale of the guide mark. The guide mark grows linearly with the increasing distance between tool tip and the plan start point. This maximum keeps the guide mark from growing out of convenience.

GuideArrowColour.description: Colour of the guide arrow using R/G/B colour scheme

CaptionColour.description: The colour of the caption using R/G/B colour scheme

CaptionPosition.description: The position, in normalized viewport coordinates, of the caption relative to the position of the guide arrow tail point.

CaptionSize.description: Sets the size of the caption rectangle in view port normalized measures.

AngleRatio.description: The ratio used to increase (or decrease) the view angle of the camera after it has been determined by coverage points. If the ratio is set to 1, one of the coverage points will fall on the border of the view port. To bring it further in, the ratio must be set to a value slightly greater than 1.

ThresholdRatio.description: The ratio of the threshold distance and the camera focal distance. The threshold distance is the distance that determines if the distance of the camera should be increased. If any of the points fall behind the threshold plane (normal to the camera axis) looking from the focal point, the camera is moved away from the focal point (kept fixed) to increase the distance and fit the point within the threshold range.

DistanceModificationFactor.description: The factor by which the camera distance is increased or decreased when the view angle is below the minimum or above the maximum angle.

MinimumAngle.description: The minimum view angle of the camera. If the calculated view angle is below this measure, the camera is moved toward the focal point using DistanceModificationFactor and calculation is performed again (up to three times).

MaximumAngle.description: The maximum view angle of the camera. If the calculated view angle is above this measure, the camera is moved away from the focal point using DistanceModificationFactor and calculation is performed again (up to three times).

MinimumDistance.description: The minimum focal distance of the camera. No matter how small the calculated view angle, the focal point will not be moved closer than this measure to the camera.

MaximumDistance.description: The maximum focal distance of the camera. No matter how great the calculated view angle, the focal point will not be moved further than this measure away from the focal point.

MaximumAngleCalculationPasses.description: The maximum number of times the calculation of the view angle is performed if it is not within the acceptable range.

PilotRotationAngleStep.description: Angle step in degrees for pilot coordinate system rotation by pressing Right or Left key.

VisibilityMarginInAnatomicalPlanesDirect.description: Specifies the needed distance between two slice (landmark slice and tool position slice ) for visbilty of landmarks,the reported distabce in application is direct distnace between 2 points

StrayMarkersDistance.description: Distance between two stray markers in biopsy tool.

DistanceTolerance.description: Distance tolerance between two stray markers in biopsy tool.

WidgetProperties.description: Display properties of the widget in the viewers including line width factor, colour composition, etc.

ColorComposition.description: Colour composition for the three principal axes of the widget. The colour values should be coded as "RRR GGG BBB" where RRR, GGG, and BBB are decimal intensity values for Red, Green, and Blue channels.

LineWidthFactor.description: Scale factor for the width of the lines comprising the widget.

WidgetPickingTolerance.description: The Area that widget is picked around widget.

ImageSliceViewerZoomFactorForCtImages.description: Using this option, you can override the ImageSliceViewerZoomFactor option for displaying of CT images. It is understood that CT images usually need to be viewed with a greater zoom than MR images.

ImageSliceViewerZoomFactor.description: Zoom factor of the slice generated from a 3D image. By default (zoom factor being 1), side length of the slice quad is equal to the diagonal of the image box. Modifying this value divides the default length of the image slice side by the specified factor.

ImageSliceViewerZoomFactorForDentalViews.description: Zoom factor for the slices generated for the dental specific views Distal-Mesial and Lingual-Buccal.

TransFunctionsAddresses.description: Contains a map of address of a transfunction for each modality that describes the color map for each modality.

TeethViewing.description: Address for Dental volume rendering colormap.

SpineViewing.description: Address for Spine volume rendering colormap.

SkinViewing.description: Address for MRI SkinTransparentViewing volume rendering colormap.

SkinFilledViewing.description: Address for MRI SkinFiledViewing volume rendering colormap.

AllViewing.description: Address for MRI AllViewing volume rendering colormap.

SinusesViewing.description: Address for MRI Sinus Viewing volume rendering colormap.

DataCheckingSliderRange.description: Set range of threshold slider in data checking tab.

VisibilityMarginInAnatomicalPlanesDirect.description: Specifies the needed distance between two slice (landmark slice and tool position slice ) for visbilty of landmarks,the reported distabce in application is direct distnace between 2 points
